metadata.name: New Remote Desktop Connection Initiated Via Mstsc.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the usage of "mstsc.exe" with the "/v" flag to initiate a connection to a remote server. Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\mstsc.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('mstsc.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -v:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /v:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –v:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —v:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―v:'))) AND NOT (lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\lxss\\wslhost.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\programdata\\microsoft\\wsl\\wslg.rdp'))))

output.summary: Detects the usage of "mstsc.exe" with the "/v" flag to initiate a connection to a remote server. Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

metadata.objective: False positive: WSL (Windows Sub System For Linux) References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1021.001/T1021.001.md#t1021001---remote-desktop-protocol, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/mstsc
